channel.title: 2011-3-15 on eoc.online - Insights & Resources for EOCs
channel.description: Recent content in 2011-3-15 on eoc.online - Insights & Resources for EOCs

item.title: Vashon Receives Huge 350 kW Emergency Generator from Franciscan Health System
item.description:
Diesel-powered unit will serve community shelter during power outages 

Franciscan Health System has donated a large emergency-power generator to the community of Vashon Island so residents can have a safe, warm, lighted building in which to seek shelter when Mother Nature knocks out electricity to homes and businesses in the area.

item.title: Visual Results of Japanese Tsunami
item.description: www.abc.net.au/news/events/japan-quake-2011/beforeafter.htm has incredible photos of the Japanese earthquake’s aftereffects – as contrasted with an initial view of the same scene.

item.title: Most people not insured for earthquakes and floods
item.description: You may think your insurance policy covers your home, apartment or business for earthquakes and floods. The Northwest Insurance Council thinks you should take a closer look, because many people are not insured for such national disasters.

item.title: Japan-- 5th Largest Earthquake
item.description: Gauges at the University of Washington lit up for hours after the initial Japanese earthquake, which now has been determined to be the fifth largest earthquake in the world since 1900.

item.title: Quake most expensive yet
item.description: Losses from the quake, tsunami and fires will total at least $100 billion, including $20 billion in damage to residences and $40 billion in damage to infrastructure such as roads, rail and port facilities, catastrophe modeling firm Eqecat estimated.

item.title: Quake shifts Japan 13’ East
item.description: “This week's earthquake caused the main island of Japan to shift as much as 13 feet to the east, seismologists say. That may sound like a shocker, but it's just one of the natural changes that come along with an 8.9-magnitude temblor — like the 1.6-microsecond speed-up of Earth's daily rotation and the 4-inch shift in Earth's axis.”
